byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

abstract: William Schabas, Canadian law professor who resigned as head of United Nations investigation into 2014 Gaza conflict, says his work was impeded by threats, pressure from Israel and investigation into his background and work he did for Palestinian Liberation Organization; Schabas says he was not prepared for vitriol directed at him.
lead_paragraph: William Schabas, who resigned last week, said his appointment to a United Nations inquiry into last summer’s Gaza conflict had been troubled from the outset.

headline.main: Former Head of Inquiry Into Gaza War Says He Faced Pressure and Threats
headline.print_headline: Former Head of Inquiry Into Gaza War Says He Faced Pressure and Threats

snippet: William Schabas, who resigned last week, said his appointment to a United Nations inquiry into last summer’s Gaza conflict had been troubled from the outset.
